posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Ending with an odd ability score is a big no if it can be avoided in my book. I also do not get why you are pumping Str at all. I'd start with Dex 17, Con 14 and then pump only Dex up to 22. AC and AB will both benefit. As an halfling your thrown weapons will hit at the same AB as kukris. I'd also go with daggers vs kukris and skip the IC feat. That would free up 2 feat slots for PBS/RS. I see you are missing BF, it could be put in instead of LoH. If you are really concerned by the will save (which can be covered through UMD/gear usually) I'd look into getting Iron Will instead.

Lore is kinda wasted points, especially since you have no disable traps nor search or OL. Your set trap is even too high, a 15 modified score (25 for gas traps) is all you need. If you drop lore for disable trap you'll also benefit from the synergy bonus btw. I'd consider going without discipline depending on the playing environment.

Nice idea recreating OotS characters btw. Well done.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
TBH, I would use only 1 level of barb to retain the roleplay aspect of the class selection and to keep rage. Uncanny Dodge you will get with assassin anyway so there is nothing to lose but 2HP if you swap it for ranger. I'd get that 10th level of ranger for the additional FE, especially seeing as how it is a typical, low damage dexer build. And that additional level will help the duration of ranger spells that will not be extended. Therefore, my choice would be Rgr10/Barb1/Assn9.

Oh, one other thing... shouldn't your Will save increase by 2 (to 11) from Iron Will? With all the class swapping, the unmodified Will save shouldn't change because none of the classes used have Will as a primary save. (I'm surprised Kamiryn's spreadsheet didn't calculate the increase. ?!?! ) Or have you somehow dropped Wisdom down when you changed the abilities around? Strange.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
RE: 1. It was just a theme Dzmitry decide to adopt for a build or two on a whim.  There is no centralized repository for Order of the Stick builds that I've read or heard about, definitely none within the ECB, current or legacy.

RE: 2.  DW kukris go well together with Keen Edge scrolls and UMD.  Piercing weapons cannot benefit likewise.

What seems to be missing in this build as it stands is at least one detection skill.  There is plenty of excess in both locks and set traps, enough to max Listen and in that case I'd add SkF: Listen as the substitute feat. 

It's also possible to use the barb as a dump class for taunting by reordering a bit, in which case I'd use the Taunt/Expertise feat exploit.  There's really no need to take barb so early considering UD is duplicated at Asn 2.  You can't taunt while in stealth, though, but would be effective against True seers, dragons, horrors, fortified bosses, etc.

This build portrays the halfling ranger/barbarian Belkar. He is the only evil character in the party. He is keen on killing any- and everything and has the attitude of a munchkin. His character has a giant flaw: He is a ranger and their pathfinder, and as such supposed to have tracking and detection abilities. But he has none of that, and that becomes a bit embarrassing from time to time.
